intro: Notopleura guadalupensis subsp. grosourdieana, commonly known as the Guadalupensis subspecies, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Mexico. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its woody structure and showy, pentagonal flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically ovate with serrated edges, and it thrives in well-drained, sandy soils. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological features and limited distribution.
